sentences.sentence: The EU threatens further sanctions against Russia after President Vladimir Putin announces plans to move nuclear weapons to neighboring Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Anger erupts across Israel after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu thanks his defense minister for challenging a controversial judicial reform plan.

sentences.sentence: The search for missing continues after a deadly tornado kills at least 26 people in the US.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The US says it has seen no indication that Russia has moved nuclear weapons to neighboring Belarus,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: despite President Vladimir Putin announcing plans to station such weapons there.

sentences.sentence: despite President Vladimir Putin announcing plans to station such weapons there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Russian leader's declaration during an interview at the weekend has brought swift condemnation from NATO, calling it dangerous and irresponsible rhetoric.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The EU's foreign policy chief, Joseph Borre, cautioned Belarus against hosting Russian nuclear weapons on its territory. Borre tweeted, Belarus hosting Russian nuclear weapons on its territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Burey tweeted, Belarus hosting Russian nuclear weapons would mean an irresponsible escalation and threat to European security. Belarus can still stop it, it is their choice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The EU stands, ready to respond with further sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko is a close ally to Putin and allowed his country to be used as staging ground to send Russian troops into Ukraine last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Russia says the plan to station tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus is in response to the West's increasing military support for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And he notes that Washington has nuclear weapons in Belgium, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands and Turkey. Ukraine has demanded an emergency meeting of the UN Security Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: An explosion in Russia injured three people, including a 16-year-old girl, on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Russian authorities blamed a Ukrainian drone for the blast 175 kilometers south of Moscow. Ukraine has not commented on the explosion that reportedly damaged three residential buildings, four houses and created a crater around five meters deep.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The Russian state-run news agency TASS claimed the explosion was caused by a Soviet-made TU-141 drone, which was reintroduced in Ukraine in 2014, after it was tired from service in 1989. Similar drone attacks have been common during the war, although Ukraine hardly ever acknowledges responsibility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of Israelis poured onto the streets of cities across the country on Sunday night in an outburst of anger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It followed the sacking of Israel's defense minister by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for challenging the leader's judicial overhaul plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Protesters in Tel Aviv blocked a main highway and lit large bonfires, while police scuffled with crowds outside Netanyahu's private home in Jerusalem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In a brief televised statement on Saturday, the now former defense minister Yoav Galant had warned that weeks of protests to the judicial plan were a security threat and should be scrapped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Netanyahu's government is to hold a parliamentary vote this week on a centrepiece of the overhaul, a law that will give the governing coalition the final say over all judicial appointments. It also seeks to pass laws to grant Parliament the authority to override Supreme Court decisions with a basic majority and limit judicial review of laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: with a basic majority and limit judicial review of laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Critics say the reforms will remove checks and balances on Israel's democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: President Joe Biden tweeted that he and the First Lady were praying for those who have lost loved ones and those whose loved ones are missing, promising full federal support. We hear people need help and it was just devastating last night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's one of the world's largest grassroots movement for the environment, and for a 17th year in a row, millions of people have celebrated Earth Hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: From Italy to Taiwan and Australia, residents turned off all the lights and electrical appliances in their homes and offices for one hour to promote energy conservation and raise awareness of climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: More than 190 countries and territories took part, with EU member states this year branching out to highlight the importance of European nature.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Governments and companies also turned off non-essential lights in their buildings, monuments and landmarks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This lights-off gesture is symbolic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The deeper aim of Earth Hour is to encourage households, communities and leaders to take accountability for their ecological footprint and to start conversations to find real solutions to challenges like climate change and biodiversity loss.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
